definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: It is believed that everyone may have a token for love and an episode.
sentences.chinese: 相信每個人手中的定情信物，都有一段故事。

sentences.english: Please have this ring for a keepsake .
sentences.chinese: 請收下這個戒指作爲信物。

sentences.english: He often stared a love token or a long time.
sentences.chinese: 他常常盯着一個愛的信物很久。

sentences.english: I give you this ring as a pledge of my love for you.
sentences.chinese: 我把這隻戒指送給你作爲愛的信物。

sentences.english: Flowers do with Valentine's Day Xinwu in about two centuries after.
sentences.chinese: 用鮮花做瓦淪丁節的信物在大約兩百年後出現。

sentences.english: Hey, don't touch that bike; it's my apple of love.
sentences.chinese: 別碰那輛自行車，那可是我的愛情信物。

sentences.english: You can purchase a token of affection.
sentences.chinese: 你能買份不錯的定情信物。

sentences.english: And this, O this shall henceforth be the token of comrades.
sentences.chinese: 而這個，啊，這個將成爲夥伴的信物。

sentences.english: Each of them kept a half as tokens in case they were separated.
sentences.chinese: 如果將來夫妻失散了，就把它當作信物。

sentences.english: Please have this ring for a keepsake.
sentences.chinese: 請收下這枚戒指作爲信物。

sentences.english: As a token of your love?

definition: (archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
